ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Form used/assessment name
Notes: e.g., Self-Report, Parent Form, Short Form, Revised Version

ElementDescription: Across many different situations, I manage to behave in a manner appropriate to that situation.
Notes: 1 = Totally false, not at all true; 2 = Slightly true; 3 = Mainly true; 4 = Very true

ElementDescription: All I can really understand about other people are their weaknesses.
Notes: 1 = Totally false, not at all true; 2 = Slightly true; 3 = Mainly true; 4 = Very true

ElementDescription: Almost no close relationship turns out well in the end.
Notes: 1 = Totally false, not at all true; 2 = Slightly true; 3 = Mainly true; 4 = Very true

ElementDescription: Although I might have different feelings at different times, I can handle all of them pretty well.
Notes: 1 = Totally false, not at all true; 2 = Slightly true; 3 = Mainly true; 4 = Very true

ElementDescription: Although I try, I can't seem to keep any successful, lasting relationships.
Notes: 1 = Totally false, not at all true; 2 = Slightly true; 3 = Mainly true; 4 = Very true

ElementDescription: Although I value close relationships, sometimes strong emotions get in the way.
Notes: 1 = Totally false, not at all true; 2 = Slightly true; 3 = Mainly true; 4 = Very true

ElementDescription: Events in my life can really change whether or not I feel good about myself.
Notes: 1 = Totally false, not at all true; 2 = Slightly true; 3 = Mainly true; 4 = Very true

ElementDescription: Feedback from others plays a big role in determining what is important to me.
Notes: 1 = Totally false, not at all true; 2 = Slightly true; 3 = Mainly true; 4 = Very true

ElementDescription: Getting close to others has little appeal to me.
Notes: 1 = Totally false, not at all true; 2 = Slightly true; 3 = Mainly true; 4 = Very true

ElementDescription: Getting close to others just leaves me vulnerable and isn't really worth the risk.
Notes: 1 = Totally false, not at all true; 2 = Slightly true; 3 = Mainly true; 4 = Very true

ElementDescription: I can appreciate the viewpoint of other people even when I disagree with them.
Notes: 1 = Totally false, not at all true; 2 = Slightly true; 3 = Mainly true; 4 = Very true

ElementDescription: I can only get close to somebody who understands me very well.
Notes: 1 = Totally false, not at all true; 2 = Slightly true; 3 = Mainly true; 4 = Very true

ElementDescription: I can only get close to someone who can acknowledge and address my needs.
Notes: 1 = Totally false, not at all true; 2 = Slightly true; 3 = Mainly true; 4 = Very true

ElementDescription: I can step back and objectively evaluate the way that I'm feeling at any given time.
Notes: 1 = Totally false, not at all true; 2 = Slightly true; 3 = Mainly true; 4 = Very true

ElementDescription: I can't always tell the difference between what is my opinion, and what is the way other people want me to think.
Notes: 1 = Totally false, not at all true; 2 = Slightly true; 3 = Mainly true; 4 = Very true

ElementDescription: I can't even imagine living a life that I would find satisfying.
Notes: 1 = Totally false, not at all true; 2 = Slightly true; 3 = Mainly true; 4 = Very true

ElementDescription: I can't stand it when there are sharp differences of opinion.
Notes: 1 = Totally false, not at all true; 2 = Slightly true; 3 = Mainly true; 4 = Very true

ElementDescription: I don't have a clue about why other people do what they do.
Notes: 1 = Totally false, not at all true; 2 = Slightly true; 3 = Mainly true; 4 = Very true

ElementDescription: I don't have many positive interactions with other people.
Notes: 1 = Totally false, not at all true; 2 = Slightly true; 3 = Mainly true; 4 = Very true

ElementDescription: I don't pay much attention to, or care very much about, the effect I have on other people.
Notes: 1 = Totally false, not at all true; 2 = Slightly true; 3 = Mainly true; 4 = Very true

ElementDescription: I don't understand what motivates other people at all.
Notes: 1 = Totally false, not at all true; 2 = Slightly true; 3 = Mainly true; 4 = Very true

ElementDescription: I don't waste time thinking about my experiences, feelings, and actions.
Notes: 1 = Totally false, not at all true; 2 = Slightly true; 3 = Mainly true; 4 = Very true

ElementDescription: I have a strong need for others to approve of me.
Notes: 1 = Totally false, not at all true; 2 = Slightly true; 3 = Mainly true; 4 = Very true

ElementDescription: I have difficult setting and completing goals.
Notes: 1 = Totally false, not at all true; 2 = Slightly true; 3 = Mainly true; 4 = Very true

ElementDescription: I have little understanding of how I feel or what I do.
Notes: 1 = Totally false, not at all true; 2 = Slightly true; 3 = Mainly true; 4 = Very true

ElementDescription: I have many satisfying relationships, both personally and on the job.
Notes: 1 = Totally false, not at all true; 2 = Slightly true; 3 = Mainly true; 4 = Very true

ElementDescription: I have relationships, but not many that I consider to be very close.
Notes: 1 = Totally false, not at all true; 2 = Slightly true; 3 = Mainly true; 4 = Very true

ElementDescription: I have some difficulty setting goals.
Notes: 1 = Totally false, not at all true; 2 = Slightly true; 3 = Mainly true; 4 = Very true

ElementDescription: I have trouble deciding between different goals.
Notes: 1 = Totally false, not at all true; 2 = Slightly true; 3 = Mainly true; 4 = Very true

ElementDescription: I mainly act in the moment, rather than focusing on long term goals.
Notes: 1 = Totally false, not at all true; 2 = Slightly true; 3 = Mainly true; 4 = Very true

ElementDescription: I mainly pay attention to others to the extent that they are likely to impact me in some way.
Notes: 1 = Totally false, not at all true; 2 = Slightly true; 3 = Mainly true; 4 = Very true

ElementDescription: I mainly pay attention to people based upon what they might do to me, or for me.
Notes: 1 = Totally false, not at all true; 2 = Slightly true; 3 = Mainly true; 4 = Very true

ElementDescription: I never seem to have much hope that good things will happen to me.
Notes: 1 = Totally false, not at all true; 2 = Slightly true; 3 = Mainly true; 4 = Very true

ElementDescription: I set personal standards for myself that are very difficult to satisfy.
Notes: 1 = Totally false, not at all true; 2 = Slightly true; 3 = Mainly true; 4 = Very true

ElementDescription: I tend to feel either really good or really bad about myself.
Notes: 1 = Totally false, not at all true; 2 = Slightly true; 3 = Mainly true; 4 = Very true

ElementDescription: I tend to let others set my goals for me, rather than come up with them on my own.
Notes: 1 = Totally false, not at all true; 2 = Slightly true; 3 = Mainly true; 4 = Very true

ElementDescription: I try hard to be flexible and cooperative when dealing with others.
Notes: 1 = Totally false, not at all true; 2 = Slightly true; 3 = Mainly true; 4 = Very true

ElementDescription: I typically understand other peoples' feelings better than they do.
Notes: 1 = Totally false, not at all true; 2 = Slightly true; 3 = Mainly true; 4 = Very true

ElementDescription: I work on my close relationships, because they are important to me.
Notes: 1 = Totally false, not at all true; 2 = Slightly true; 3 = Mainly true; 4 = Very true

ElementDescription: I'm confident about the difference between my values and those that others might want me to have.
Notes: 1 = Totally false, not at all true; 2 = Slightly true; 3 = Mainly true; 4 = Very true

ElementDescription: I'm no good at stepping back and looking objectively at my life.
Notes: 1 = Totally false, not at all true; 2 = Slightly true; 3 = Mainly true; 4 = Very true

ElementDescription: I'm not sure exactly what standards I've set for myself.
Notes: 1 = Totally false, not at all true; 2 = Slightly true; 3 = Mainly true; 4 = Very true

ElementDescription: I'm only interested in relationships that can provide me with some comfort.
Notes: 1 = Totally false, not at all true; 2 = Slightly true; 3 = Mainly true; 4 = Very true

ElementDescription: I'm very aware of the impact I'm having on other people.
Notes: 1 = Totally false, not at all true; 2 = Slightly true; 3 = Mainly true; 4 = Very true

ElementDescription: In a close relationship, it's as if I can't live without the other person.
Notes: 1 = Totally false, not at all true; 2 = Slightly true; 3 = Mainly true; 4 = Very true

ElementDescription: In close relationships I tend to be torn between being afraid and being "clingy".
Notes: 1 = Totally false, not at all true; 2 = Slightly true; 3 = Mainly true; 4 = Very true

ElementDescription: In many situations I feel quite differently than others seem to expect me to feel.
Notes: 1 = Totally false, not at all true; 2 = Slightly true; 3 = Mainly true; 4 = Very true

ElementDescription: In very trying times, I sometimes lose sight of what is important to me.
Notes: 1 = Totally false, not at all true; 2 = Slightly true; 3 = Mainly true; 4 = Very true

ElementDescription: Interacting with other people usually leaves me feeling confused.
Notes: 1 = Totally false, not at all true; 2 = Slightly true; 3 = Mainly true; 4 = Very true

ElementDescription: It seems as if most other people have their life together more than I.
Notes: 1 = Totally false, not at all true; 2 = Slightly true; 3 = Mainly true; 4 = Very true

ElementDescription: I've got goals that are reasonable given my abilities.
Notes: 1 = Totally false, not at all true; 2 = Slightly true; 3 = Mainly true; 4 = Very true

ElementDescription: I've had lasting relationships, but they haven't always been very satisfying.
Notes: 1 = Totally false, not at all true; 2 = Slightly true; 3 = Mainly true; 4 = Very true

ElementDescription: Life is a dangerous place without a lot of meaning to it.
Notes: 1 = Totally false, not at all true; 2 = Slightly true; 3 = Mainly true; 4 = Very true

ElementDescription: Many people around me have very destructive motives.
Notes: 1 = Totally false, not at all true; 2 = Slightly true; 3 = Mainly true; 4 = Very true

ElementDescription: Most things that I do are a reaction to what others do.
Notes: 1 = Totally false, not at all true; 2 = Slightly true; 3 = Mainly true; 4 = Very true

ElementDescription: My emotions rapidly shift around.
Notes: 1 = Totally false, not at all true; 2 = Slightly true; 3 = Mainly true; 4 = Very true

ElementDescription: My life is basically controlled by the actions of others.
Notes: 1 = Totally false, not at all true; 2 = Slightly true; 3 = Mainly true; 4 = Very true

ElementDescription: My motives are mainly imposed upon me, rather than being a personal choice.
Notes: 1 = Totally false, not at all true; 2 = Slightly true; 3 = Mainly true; 4 = Very true

ElementDescription: My personal standards change quite a bit depending upon circumstances.
Notes: 1 = Totally false, not at all true; 2 = Slightly true; 3 = Mainly true; 4 = Very true

ElementDescription: Other people often expect too much from me.
Notes: 1 = Totally false, not at all true; 2 = Slightly true; 3 = Mainly true; 4 = Very true

ElementDescription: People think I am pretty good at reading the feelings and motives of others in most situations.
Notes: 1 = Totally false, not at all true; 2 = Slightly true; 3 = Mainly true; 4 = Very true

ElementDescription: People think I'm a "hater", but it's often more related to them than to me.
Notes: 1 = Totally false, not at all true; 2 = Slightly true; 3 = Mainly true; 4 = Very true

ElementDescription: Relationships are mainly a source of pain and suffering.
Notes: 1 = Totally false, not at all true; 2 = Slightly true; 3 = Mainly true; 4 = Very true

ElementDescription: Sometimes all I care about are my goals.
Notes: 1 = Totally false, not at all true; 2 = Slightly true; 3 = Mainly true; 4 = Very true

ElementDescription: Sometimes I am too harsh on myself.
Notes: 1 = Totally false, not at all true; 2 = Slightly true; 3 = Mainly true; 4 = Very true

ElementDescription: Sometimes I feel that certain other people are just like me; other times I believe they are nothing like me at all.
Notes: 1 = Totally false, not at all true; 2 = Slightly true; 3 = Mainly true; 4 = Very true

ElementDescription: Sometimes I'm not very cooperative because other people don't live up to my standards.
Notes: 1 = Totally false, not at all true; 2 = Slightly true; 3 = Mainly true; 4 = Very true

ElementDescription: Sometimes it is easy for me to overlook the impact that I'm having on others.
Notes: 1 = Totally false, not at all true; 2 = Slightly true; 3 = Mainly true; 4 = Very true

ElementDescription: The key to a successful relationship is whether I am getting my needs met.
Notes: 1 = Totally false, not at all true; 2 = Slightly true; 3 = Mainly true; 4 = Very true

ElementDescription: The standards that I set for myself often seem to be too demanding, or not demanding enough.
Notes: 1 = Totally false, not at all true; 2 = Slightly true; 3 = Mainly true; 4 = Very true

ElementDescription: The way that others perceive me is totally different from the way that I really am.
Notes: 1 = Totally false, not at all true; 2 = Slightly true; 3 = Mainly true; 4 = Very true

ElementDescription: There are parts of my personality that just don't fit together very well.
Notes: 1 = Totally false, not at all true; 2 = Slightly true; 3 = Mainly true; 4 = Very true

ElementDescription: When dealing with people, I mainly pay attention to how they are likely to affect me.
Notes: 1 = Totally false, not at all true; 2 = Slightly true; 3 = Mainly true; 4 = Very true

ElementDescription: When feelings get too strong, I try to shut myself off from them.
Notes: 1 = Totally false, not at all true; 2 = Slightly true; 3 = Mainly true; 4 = Very true

ElementDescription: When I feel that I've done something well, I'm almost always right.

ElementDescription: Do you live with your partner?
Does needing to get things just right make it hard to set or achieve goals for yourself?
Is it hard to decide on your goals or which should be top priority?
Is it important to you to achieve certain things so that other people will like you or approve of you?
Have you pursued goals that other important people in your life disapprove of? Could you give some examples?
Do you become confused about your goals if you aren't sure what others think you should do?
Do you usually get really confused and overwhelmed when you think about trying to accomplish things in your life?
Has it been hard for you to set or achieve goals in your life?
Have you failed to do what needs to be done to achieve your goals?
Do you dream big dreams for your life but don't ever manage to take action? For example?
Do you usually feel so overwhelmed that it is a challenge just to manage from day to day so that setting goals for the future is just too hard?
Have you ever been married?
Notes: 0=No; 1=Yes; 999=Refused

ElementDescription: Ability to Pursue Meaningful Goals Score
Notes: 0=Little or no impairment; 1=Some impairment; 2=Moderate impairment; 3=Severe impairment; 4=Extreme impairment

ElementDescription: Tell me about what kinds of standards you have set for yourself in terms of your behavior and morals.
Do you have a good idea about how you should behave and what you need to do to have a successful and fulfilling life?
Does it feel like you have solid values and know what to do to get along with others and have a satisfying life?
Do you think that you have a generally satisfying life?
Are you typically perfectionistic or expect things of yourself other people might consider unreasonable?
Do you have high personal standards that you need to stick to?
Is it important to you to always follow your rules or values no matter how it might affect other people?
Is it top priority for you to do things to please others or demonstrate that you are special?
Is it important to you to create just the right impression to please others, or to get what you want?
How many times have you been married in your lifetime, including your current marriage?
Are your values and ideals usually superior to most other people's?
Do you think people should just get out of your way and let you do what you want?
Are you willing to ignore the rules to get what you want?
Do you have a hard time trying to figure out whose values you should try to live by?
Do you sometimes see clearly what your values are and how you want to behave, only to become quickly confused again?
Do you feel like you are constantly failing yourself and others and there is no point in trying to do the right thing?
Is life just too hard to know what is right or wrong?
Do you generally feel that life is meaningless or dangerous?
Is life just an ongoing struggle to survive in any way you can?
Are rules irrelevant in this dog-eat-dog world?
Do you have any children?
Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes (specify); 3= NA/Unmarried

ElementDescription: Do you almost always feel like you have no idea about how you should act or what is expected of you?
Constructive, Prosocial Internal Standards of Behavior Score
Notes: 0=Little or no impairment; 1=Some impairment; 2=Moderate impairment; 3=Severe impairment; 4=Extreme impairment

ElementDescription: How well do you know how your mind works-that is, how you think about things?
Is it hard to think about things when you become emotional or anxious?
Is it fairly easy for you to understand what is going on in your own head?
Can you usually make constructive use of your thoughts and feelings?
Do you tend to focus much more on how you think than on how you feel?
How about the opposite...do you focus almost entirely on your feelings to the exclusion of everything else?
Is it often a challenge for you to figure out your mind, or what your perspective is on things?
Do you need other people to give you input to be able to figure out what you are thinking and feeling?
How many children do you have? What are their ages?
Do you often find that you don't know what you think or feel about something unless you bounce it off somebody else?
Are you often pretty baffled about what makes you behave the way you do?
Do you get confused when you try to figure out your own perspective or motivations?
Do you often do things and act in certain ways without having any idea of why?
Do your emotions take over you so you often can't even think straight?
Are you generally at a complete loss as to what you are thinking or feeling?
Do you find that you are always on guard, reacting to what the world is throwing at you?
Is it hard to think straight much of the time because everything is so uncertain and you have to worry about others harming or taking advantage of you?
Self-Reflective Functioning Score
Notes: 0=Little or no impairment; 1=Some impairment; 2=Moderate impairment; 3=Severe impairment; 4=Extreme impairment

ElementDescription: Self-Direction Score
Notes: Mean score (scid_ampd_ampg_score, scid_ampd_cpisb_score, scid_ampd_srf_score)

ElementDescription: With whom do you live? (How many children under the age of 18 live in your household?)
Is it easy for you to understand where other people are coming from?
How important is it to you to know what other people's concerns and experiences are?
Do you usually know what makes other people tick and why they do the things they do?
Have you found it easy to understand your partner in romantic relationships?
Are you generally able to put yourself in other people's shoes?
Are you surprised that some people have such different opinions from yours?
Do you often find it hard to appreciate how others feel about things and about you?
Do you tend to feel that people expect too much from you?
Are you interested in what other people say or do mostly so you can take care of yourself and your own interests?
Do you go out of your way to understand others so that you can stay in their good graces?
How far did you go in school? IF FAILED TO COMPLETE A PROGRAM IN WHICH INDIVIDUAL WAS ENROLLED: Why did you leave?
What about going out of your way to know the proper thing to do?
Do you need to know what is going on with them to make sure they are not thinking badly of you?
Is it hard for you to understand why people do things that hurt or upset you?
Do you often find other people to be really confusing, unreliable, manipulative, or deceitful?
Are there certain people that you can see right through, that is, you immediately sense what is going on with them?
Do you easily pick up on other people's pain?
Do you find other people's motivations to be completely mystifying to you?
Do most other people seem to do things without rhyme or reason?
Is it just really hard to know what people will come at you with?
Comprehension and Appreciation of Others Experiences and Motivations Score
Notes: 0=Little or no impairment; 1=Some impairment; 2=Moderate impairment; 3=Severe impairment; 4=Extreme impairment

ElementDescription: Are you currently employed (getting paid)? IF NO: Why not? IF UNKNOWN: Has there ever been a period of time when you were unable to work or go to school?
How do you deal with people who have opinions that are really different from yours?
How has it been for you if a partner or spouse has disagreed with you?
Are you generally able to understand and appreciate other people's viewpoints when they disagree with you?
Even if you can understand someone else's opinion, does it annoy you if they don't agree with you?
Do you generally consider your way of doing things, or your perspective, to be the best or right way?
Is it a top priority that your opinion is heard and appreciated by others?
Is it boring to have to listen other people's stories and opinions?
Do you generally find that other people's opinions are not worth listening to unless they agree with yours?
Have you been told sometimes that you don't seem very interested in what other people have to say?
Do you become really confused about your own ideas when someone else expresses a strong opinion?
What kind of work do you do in your industry?
Is it upsetting or threatening to think that somebody you know could have really different ideas from yours?
Do you have to be very careful to protect yourself from other people because you never know where they might be coming from?
Is it such a top priority to take care of yourself or guard against getting hurt that you never consider what other people think?
Tolerance of Differing Perspectives Score
Notes: 0=Little or no impairment; 1=Some impairment; 2=Moderate impairment; 3=Severe impairment; 4=Extreme impairment

ElementDescription: How much impact do you think your actions have on other people?
Do you wonder sometimes why your partner or spouse reacts to you in certain ways?
Are you usually aware of the effect of your actions on other people?
If you hurt or offend someone, can you usually figure out what you did to cause that?
Are you sometimes surprised or puzzled when people react in certain ways to things you do?
Are you generally not very concerned about how your actions affect other people?
Do you work outside of the home?
Notes: 0=No;1=Yes

ElementDescription: Are you surprised or upset when other people don't appreciate what you do?
Is it most important to be able to do what you want when you want to do it regardless of the impact it has on others?
Does it seem like almost everything you do impacts everyone else?
On the other hand, do you think that no matter what you do, other people will be disappointed or disregard you?
Do you often find yourself in unpleasant or confusing situations with people? Can you give me some examples of this?
Do people react to your behavior in ways that make no sense to you?
Do people tend to get aggressive with you for no good reason? Can you give me some examples of this?
Are most people just better avoided so they don't hassle or take advantage of you in some way?
Do you find that the ways people react to you leave you dumbfounded or disoriented?
Understanding of Effects of Own Behavior on Others Score
Notes: 0=Little or no impairment; 1=Some impairment; 2=Moderate impairment; 3=Severe impairment; 4=Extreme impairment

ElementDescription: Have you always done that kind of work? IF NO: What other kind of work have you done in the past?
Empathy Score
Notes: Mean score (scid_ampd_caoem_score, scid_ampd_tdp_score, scid_ampd_ueobo_score)

ElementDescription: Tell me about some important relationships you have in your life. IF TALKS ABOUT ONLY FAMILY MEMBERS: Do you have good friends outside your family? IF ONLY TALKS ABOUT ONE OR TWO PEOPLE: Are there other people in your life you are close to?
Are there several people in your life that you have known a long time and feel close to?
Do you feel like a valued member of your community?
Do you feel like you have had a number of friendships in your life but sometimes they are not really that deep or satisfying?
Are you too absorbed in your work, hobbies, or other activities to be able to spend enough time with friends or family?
Do you feel like you have to put on a facade or that you are just playing a role in your relationships or your community life?
Do you have a number of acquaintances, but feel like there is a lot missing in your connections?
Do you find you want to be in relationships, but a lot of times something happens to make them go wrong? Tell me about those relationships.
Have you had a number of friendships or partnerships that have ended badly? Tell me about that.
What's the longest you've worked at one place?
Have you had very few long-term friendships or relationships in your life?
When you try to be a member of a group, do you often end up feeling on the outside or worried that people will see you as a bad or inferior person?
Are you generally disinterested in relationships with other people?
Do you usually feel detached or isolated from other people?
Do you avoid relationships because you always end up getting hurt or taken advantage of?
Are your relationships with other people generally negative?
Do you mostly stay away from relationships altogether?
Depth and Duration of Connections Score
Notes: 0=Little or no impairment; 1=Some impairment; 2=Moderate impairment; 3=Severe impairment; 4=Extreme impairment

ElementDescription: Do you like to get to know other people?
Is it easy for you to open up in relationships?
Have you ever been arrested, involved in a lawsuit, or had other legal trouble?
Do you think you let other people get to know the real you?
Do you feel close to your spouse or partner? (IF NOT CURRENTLY IN A RELATIONSHIP, ASK ABOUT RECENT PAST.)
Do you and your partner know each other really well?
Are you close to a number of people in your life?
Is it a little difficult at times to be close with people if things get too emotional or disagreements arise?
Is it important for you to try to get close to people so that you can feel appreciated or admired?
Is it important to you to have friends or a partner whom other people admire?
When you are in a friendship or relationship, do you get upset if that person doesn't understand you perfectly?
Do you feel lost if you are not in a close relationship?
When you are in a relationship with someone you really care about, do your feelings alternate between needing a perfect connection and the fear that you are going to be rejected or abandoned?
LIFETIME PSYCHIATRIC HISTORY - Have you ever seen someone for emotional or psychiatric problems?
Notes: 0 = No; 1 = Yes

ElementDescription: Do the people you form relationships with inevitably hurt or disappoint you?
Is it hard to trust people?
Do you only interact with people when it's necessary to get what you need?
Do you just mostly keep to yourself because others always end up hurting or taking advantage of you?
Desire and Capacity for Closeness Score
Notes: 0=Little or no impairment; 1=Some impairment; 2=Moderate impairment; 3=Severe impairment; 4=Extreme impairment

ElementDescription: Do you find it easy to get along with most people?
Do you like to do things with friends and family?
Do you and your spouse or partner treat each other with support and respect? (IF INTERVIEWEE NOT IN A RELATIONSHIP RIGHT NOW, CAN ASK ABOUT RECENT PAST.)
Do you readily help each other out with chores, projects, and other responsibilities?
Do you enjoy give-and-take in relationships and sharing experiences?
Was there ever a time when you, or someone else, thought you should see someone because of the way you were feeling or acting? (Tell me more.)
Is it satisfying to work on projects and do activities with others?
Does it become hard for you to cooperate with other people when they don't share your standards?
Do you tend to do things yourself so they get done correctly?
Do you get impatient, frustrated, or bored if others' perspectives or reactions don't agree with yours?
Do you primarily choose situations or relationships that clearly benefit you in some way, help you get ahead, or reflect well on you?
Do you generally only do things with or for others if there is something in it for you?

Do your relationships almost always end up one sided so that most of the focus is on your needs rather than the other person's; or do you always end up taking care of someone else at your own expense?
Is it hard to do things with others because it often feels like they disrespect you or don't meet your needs?
Are your feelings easily hurt or do you feel too vulnerable when you are in group situations?
Do you feel that most people just try to use you?

Was there ever a time when you, or someone else, thought you should see someone because of the way you were feeling or acting? What was that for? (What treatment did you get? Any medications? When was that? When was the first time you ever saw someone for emotional or psychiatric problems?)
Is it better just to avoid people altogether if they can't give you what you want or need?
Mutuality of Regard Reflected in Interpersonal Behavior Score
Notes: 0=Little or no impairment; 1=Some impairment; 2=Moderate impairment; 3=Severe impairment; 4=Extreme impairment

ElementDescription: Intimacy Score
Notes: Mean (scid_ampd_ddc_score, scid_ampd_dcc_score, scid_ampd_mrrib_score)

ElementDescription: Alternative Model for Personality Disorders Score (AMPD Score)
Notes: Mean (scid_ampd_identity_score, scid_ampd_sd_score, scid_ampd_empathy_score, scid_ampd_intimacy_score)

ElementDescription: LIFETIME PSYCHIATRIC HISTORY - Have you ever been a patient in a psychiatric hospital or a psychiatric unit in a medical hospital?
Notes: 0 = No; 1 = Yes

ElementDescription: Have you ever been a patient in a psychiatric hospital? What was that for? How many times? IF AN INADEQUATE ANSWER IS GIVEN, CHALLENGE GENTLY- e.g., Wasn't there something else? People don't usually go to psychiatric hospitals just because they are (tired/nervous/OWN WORDS)
Have you ever seen anybody for problems with alcohol or drugs? IF YES: What was that for? (What treatment[s] did you get? Any medications? When was that?)
Have you ever attended a self-help group, like Alcoholics Anonymous, Gamblers Anonymous, or Overeaters Anonymous?
Notes: 0=No; 1=Yes

ElementDescription: How old are you?
Have you ever attended a self-help group, like Alcoholics Anonymous, Gamblers Anonymous, or Overeaters Anonymous? What was that for? When was that?

Thinking back over your whole life, have there been times when things were not going well for you or when you were emotionally upset? Tell me about that. When was that? What was that like? What was going on? How were you feeling?
1. How would you describe yourself as a person?
2. How do you think other people describe you?
3. How do you generally feel about yourself?
4. How successful would you say you are at getting the things you want in life? (like having a satisfying relationship, fulfilling career, close friends?)
5. What are your relationships with other people like?
6. Who are the most important people in your life? How do you get along with them?
7. How well do you think you understand yourself?
8. How well do you understand other people?
What is your gender identity?
Notes: 1=Male; 2=Female; 3= Transgender male; 4=Non binary; 5= Transgender female; 6= Agender; 7= Gender Queer; 8= Other/Prefer to self-identify; -99=Prefer not to say; 99=Other ;-900=Missing;-300=N/A

ElementDescription: Global Code
Notes: 0=Little or no impairment; 1=Some impairment; 2=Moderate impairment; 3=Severe impairment; 4=Extreme impairment

ElementDescription: Do you sometimes have the experience of not really knowing who you are or how you are unique in the world? Tell me about that.
Do you sometimes find yourself wishing you were someone else? Tell me about that.
Do you always feel like you are your own person?
Do you generally feel that where you are in your life makes sense to you?
Are you usually aware of who you are and what your perspective is? IF YES: When you are upset, are you less aware? Give me some examples.
Do you depend on other people's opinions in order to know who you really are?
Is it hard for you to know who you are without knowing what other people think of you?
Do you tend to feel empty much of the time?
Do you sometimes completely lose the sense of who you are when interacting with others?
If 'other' for your gender identity, please specify:
Do you often take on the emotions and ideas of people you identify with?

When you are in an intense relationship with someone, do you often feel like you can't tell the difference between your feelings and the other person's or that you can't tell the difference between how you feel and how the other person feels?
Do you sometimes have the feeling that you need to retreat from others to be your own person?
Do you find yourself needing to assert your independence in order to keep from feeling swallowed up?
Do you often feel that everyone around you is out to get you, take advantage of you, or persecute you?
Do you often need to protect yourself from being hurt or taken advantage of by other people?
Do you feel that most of the time you have no sense of who you really are?
Sense of Self Score
Notes: 0=Little or no impairment; 1=Some impairment; 2=Moderate impairment; 3=Severe impairment; 4=Extreme impairment

ElementDescription: What kinds of situations or people have the potential to affect how you feel about yourself? Tell me about that.
Would you say you feel pretty good about yourself most of the time?
Are you currently married?
Notes: 0 = No; 1 = Yes

ElementDescription: Do you think you are excessively hard on yourself at times?
Do you set goals or have expectations that end up making you feel like you don't measure up?
Does how you feel about yourself depend almost entirely on what others think of you?
Do you feel bad about yourself if you don't get approval from others?
Do you typically feel inferior to everyone else?
Do you think you are better, smarter, or more attractive than almost everyone else?
Do you think others often fail to understand your special qualities?
Do you tend to feel bad about yourself very easily? Tell me about that.
When something doesn't go right for you, does it make you feel like you are a complete failure or loser?
Do you at times feel that you are better than everyone else and at other times feel you are the worst? Do you sometimes have both of these feelings at the same time?
How long have you been married?
Do you often find yourself filled with shame and self-hatred?
Have you had a lot of ups and downs or confusion in how you feel about yourself?
Do you almost always feel bad about yourself no matter what is going on or what happens?
Do you almost always feel like bad things are happening to you? Tell me about that.
Self-Esteem Score
Notes: 0=Little or no impairment; 1=Some impairment; 2=Moderate impairment; 3=Severe impairment; 4=Extreme impairment

ElementDescription: Are you an emotional person?
How do you deal with having strong feelings about things?
Would you say you are comfortable with your feelings?
Do you feel like you are able to experience the full range of feelings that people might have, like being excited, satisfied, really happy, angry, anxious, and sad?
Are you okay feeling sad, annoyed, or angry at times?
Do you have a partner?
Notes: 0 = No; 1 = Yes

ElementDescription: Do you feel uncomfortable or upset if you get emotional about something?
Do you try to keep your emotions in check because you don't like them to get out of hand?
Do you think feelings just get in the way of being reasonable?
Do you need others to appreciate or validate you in order to feel okay?
Do you feel really bad, ashamed, or very angry if other people do not understand you or say bad things about you?
Are you usually very moody and have a lot of ups and downs with your emotions?
Do you almost always feel really depressed, hopeless, or in despair?
Do you tend to have few or no feelings about situations that affect you, either good or bad?
Do you usually feel angry, irritated, and hateful toward everyone around you?
Does it seem like other people are always angry or hateful toward you?
How long have you been with your current partner together?
Can you describe situations in which that happens?
Emotional Range and Regulation Score
Notes: 0=Little or no impairment; 1=Some impairment; 2=Moderate impairment; 3=Severe impairment; 4=Extreme impairment

ElementDescription: Identity Score

ElementDescription: Are you clear on what you want to accomplish for yourself in your life? Tell me about that.
Do you know how to get ahead?
Do you have clear goals for the future?
Do you generally feel like you have a good idea of what you need to do to move forward?
Do you think you have what it takes to meet your goals in life?
Is achieving your goals the most important thing to you?
Do you typically devote most of your energy towards achieving your life goals rather than living in the present?
